claims: Deer have been found alive with arrows embedded in their bodies that later became surrounded by bone tissue.
Crows can remember humans who have hurt them and have been observed attacking those people later in groups.
Ravens are different from crows and are considered even smarter.
African gray parrots can have the IQ of a four-year-old child.
African gray parrots can perfectly imitate sounds.
African gray parrots require constant interaction and stimulation to avoid depression.
African gray parrots can harm themselves when deprived of stimulation.
Owning a parrot requires a significant time commitment.
A parrot may become aggressive or vocal when its owner leaves it alone for long periods.
Bonobo chimpanzees frequently engage in sexual activity and use it to resolve conflicts.
Bonobo chimpanzees avoid sexual relations between mothers and sons but engage in other intra-family and same-sex acts.
Bonobo chimpanzees can learn sign language but do not ask questions.
An African gray parrot was observed asking questions about how things work.
Dolphins have large frontal lobes and complex communication systems with regional dialects.
Whales have brains larger than those of humans.
Brain size relative to body mass, not absolute brain size, is what correlates with intelligence.
Neanderthals had large brains, used tools, created art, and had language but no writing.
Some theories suggest Neanderthals may have had larger eyes and possibly night vision.
Tarsiers and night monkeys are primates adapted for night vision with large eyes relative to body size.
The reflective layer in animal eyes that causes shine is called the tapetum lucidum.
Tarsiers can see in light levels as low as 0.001 lux, similar to a moonless night.
Neanderthals were hunters rather than farmers or gatherers.
The average person in Europe has around 3% Neanderthal DNA.
People of African descent have approximately 0% Neanderthal DNA.
Denisovan DNA is present in some modern human populations, possibly including Aboriginal Australians.
Yuval Noah Harari’s book 'Sapiens' argues humans outcompeted other species by cooperating in large groups through shared myths.
Humans continuously seek to improve tools and weapons through innovation.
Orangutans have been observed using spears for fishing after learning from humans.
Some animals, such as monkeys, use rocks as tools to open crabs.
Neanderthals created complex tools using flint and fibers to attach arrowheads to sticks.
Human innovation accelerated after the agricultural revolution due to food surplus and specialization.
A fossil discovery suggests Homo sapiens may have existed 500,000 years earlier than previously thought, possibly dating back one million years.
Stonehenge in the United Kingdom is composed of large stones transported from unknown origins by unknown means.
Visitors to Stonehenge often describe a sense of special energy or spiritual connection at the site.

claims: Paralysis ticks can kill dogs if not promptly removed or treated.
The Lone Star tick can transmit alpha-gal syndrome, which causes an allergic reaction to red meat.
Alpha-gal syndrome symptoms can persist for months or years and may recur after remission.
Deer farming has introduced new tick populations into regions of Australia where they were previously uncommon.
Escaped deer have expanded hundreds of kilometers from southern to northern parts of New South Wales.
Chronic wasting disease is a prion disease that infects deer and can spread through saliva and contaminated plants.
Foxes are an invasive predator species in Australia that threaten native wildlife populations.
Feral cats contribute significantly to the decline of native bird species in Australia.
Domestic cats released into the wild can become feral and disrupt local ecosystems.
The cane toad was introduced to Queensland in 1935 to control agricultural pests in sugarcane fields.
Cane toads failed to control the target pest because they could not catch flying insects.
Cane toads secrete toxins that can kill pets and native predators.
The Australian cane toad population now exceeds two hundred million individuals.
Invasive species introduced to control pests often become major ecological problems themselves.
New Zealand’s introduction of gorse for fencing created widespread environmental overgrowth due to favorable local conditions.
The invasive plant lantana has spread widely through Australian forests and displaces native vegetation.
The kudzu vine, introduced to the United States from East Asia in the nineteenth century, overgrows trees and structures and is difficult to eradicate.

claims: Nickel-rich deposits on Earth originate from ancient asteroid or comet impacts.

Earth’s fossil record shows evidence of five major mass extinction events.
Large asteroid impacts that destroy only one continent may not appear distinctly in the fossil record.
The Tunguska event in Siberia destroyed several hundred square miles of forest.
Starbase in South Texas has been formally incorporated as an official city.
Starship is designed to be the first fully and rapidly reusable orbital rocket.

The Starship rocket travels at approximately 17,000 miles per hour during reentry.
The Starship booster uses 33 Raptor engines.
Each Raptor engine produces nearly twice the thrust of all four engines on a Boeing 747.
SpaceX has achieved more than 500 successful rocket landings with the Falcon series.
SpaceX delivers roughly 90% of the total mass that reaches Earth orbit each year.
Most of SpaceX’s orbital payload consists of Starlink satellites.

claims: Some individuals who previously supported progressive or woke ideologies later changed their views after personal experiences challenged those beliefs.
In California, a school and state authorities reportedly attempted to separate a teenage girl from her father because of disagreements over her gender identity.
A teenage girl who was involved in a gender identity dispute with a California school later relocated to Texas and ceased identifying as transgender.
Some commentators describe the increase in adolescent transgender identification as a social contagion.
Public figures who criticize gender transition practices have received death threats on social media platforms.
Groups of teenagers have sometimes simultaneously identified as transgender, a pattern cited as evidence of social influence.
Children can be influenced to adopt extreme or self-destructive behaviors through indoctrination or positive reinforcement.
Certain gay and lesbian individuals have expressed opposition to being grouped together with transgender activism.
Critics argue that some children who would otherwise identify as gay are being told that they are transgender instead.
Medical procedures used in gender transitions for minors can cause irreversible sterilization and permanent loss of sexual function.
Opponents of gender transition for minors describe these procedures as a form of mutilation.
Claims that gender transition for minors prevents suicide are disputed by critics who argue the evidence does not support them.
Some studies cited by critics suggest that minors who undergo gender transition have a higher risk of suicide than those who do not.
Children in many jurisdictions are legally prohibited from getting tattoos because they are considered incapable of consenting to permanent decisions.
Sex reassignment surgeries can cause irreversible physical changes that cannot be undone later in life.
Some minors have reportedly died during surgical procedures related to gender transition.
Opponents of medical transitions for minors compare such practices to unethical historical human experimentation.
Some social media platforms have previously banned or censored users for criticizing gender transition procedures for minors.
The slogan 'protect trans kids' has been criticized as misleading when used to justify irreversible medical procedures.
The number of reported deaths and complications during gender transition surgeries for minors is not widely publicized.
Critics argue that growing numbers of people are re-evaluating or rejecting the ideology surrounding gender transition for minors.
Significant amounts of waste and fraud have been reported within government payment systems.
Automatic recurring government payments have continued even after the approving officials retired, died, or changed jobs.
A team known as Doge introduced requirements that all government payments include a congressional appropriation code and a mandatory comment field to increase accountability.
The United States Social Security Administration database has contained records of individuals listed as over 300 years old or born in future centuries.
Impossible birthdates in the United States Social Security Administration database indicate either clerical error or fraud.
The United States Social Security Administration database serves as a reference system for many other federal programs, including unemployment benefits and student loans.
If a person is incorrectly marked as alive in the United States Social Security Administration database, fraudulent claims can be made across multiple federal systems.
Erroneous entries in the United States Social Security Administration database enable exploitation of interconnected government payment programs.
Some records in the United States Social Security Administration database list individuals as older than the oldest living American.

claims: The United States Social Security Administration database contains records with impossible birthdates, including individuals listed as older than the oldest living Americans or born in the future.
Incorrect birthdates in the United States Social Security database can enable fraudulent payments to continue.
Removing invalid records from the United States Social Security database would prevent associated government payments.
The Social Security number functions as a de facto national identification number within the United States.
Financial institutions in the United States commonly request customers’ Social Security numbers for identification purposes.
Fraudulent payments from the United States federal government amount to hundreds of billions of dollars.
It is possible to trace fraudulent payments within the United States federal government without complex investigation.
Completely eliminating all fraud in the United States federal government is impractical, but reducing large-scale fraud is a reasonable goal.
Both major political parties in the United States benefit to some extent from fraudulent government payments.
A larger share of fraudulent government payments reportedly goes to organizations connected to the Democratic Party.
Some organizations or individuals associated with the Republican Party in the United States also receive fraudulent government funds and resist anti-fraud measures.
Political corruption exists across party lines in the United States.
Efforts to reduce large-scale fraud in the United States federal government can provoke hostility or threats against those implementing reforms.
Attempts to uncover and stop widespread fraud in the United States government can generate severe political backlash.
The Department of Education was created during the administration of President Jimmy Carter.
United States educational performance has declined since the creation of the Department of Education.
Before the creation of the United States Department of Education, education was managed primarily by state governments.
Competition among individual states in the United States can improve education outcomes when education policy is not federally centralized.
Many United States federal departments were established long after the country’s founding, when only a few existed, such as State, War, Treasury, and Justice.
There is ongoing debate in the United States about how much government involvement is necessary or desirable.
Government employment in nonproductive roles within the United States artificially inflates economic activity without creating real value.
Milton Friedman argued that labor should focus on productive work rather than artificial job creation.
The United States national debt has reached a level where interest payments exceed the entire military budget.
Even significant spending cuts would only delay a potential bankruptcy of the United States if economic growth remains weak.
According to the Social Security website under the Biden administration, the United States Social Security program will not be able to maintain full payments by around 2032 due to demographic trends.
Expanding artificial intelligence and robotics could help the United States grow its economy fast enough to prevent a national bankruptcy scenario.

claims: Artificial intelligence and robotics could make universal high income and sustainable abundance achievable in the future.
Eliminating financial scarcity could reduce crime rates by removing economic incentives for criminal behavior.
Some individuals commit crimes due to psychological or behavioral tendencies rather than financial necessity.
Scottish author Iain M. Banks wrote the 'Culture' series of science fiction novels, depicting a post-scarcity society created through advanced technology.
Sustainable abundance represents a vision of the future in which technology eliminates material deprivation.
Artificial intelligence systems can exhibit political or demographic bias depending on how they are trained or programmed.
AI models have at times displayed discriminatory or exclusionary outputs toward specific demographic groups.
Cultural polarization in the 2010s increased accusations of racism, sexism, and intolerance across political and social divides.
Racism and sexism can exist toward any demographic group, regardless of historical power structures.
Logical consistency requires that pride or cultural celebration should be acceptable for all groups or none.
Political bias in mainstream media can lead to selective or one-sided reporting of events.
SpaceX conducted a mission to rescue astronauts from the International Space Station with limited coverage in traditional media.
Political considerations can influence the timing or acknowledgment of space missions.
The SpaceX Starship program is designed to enable large-scale human settlement on other planets.
Starship’s capabilities exceed those of the Apollo program, which could only send small crews to the Moon for short durations.
Mainstream media outlets have provided uneven coverage of major engineering and scientific achievements.
Political and media bias can shape public perception of technology leaders and their companies.
Migration patterns between Cuba and Florida demonstrate that people move away from socialist economies toward capitalist ones.
Cuban Americans in Miami generally oppose socialism due to personal or familial experience with political repression in Cuba.
Communist governments have historically restricted emigration to prevent citizens from escaping.
Socialist economic systems often result in shortages, reduced productivity, and lower living standards.

Extended time spent in natural environments supports psychological restoration and recovery from stress.
